page.title: 10TOUR OF FLORENCECOURT HOUSE
page.content: {Dining room:}The original ceiling was saved from the fire by drilling holes for the water to run through.The tables and chairs belong to{Lord {Rossmore}and the paintings are on loan to The National Trust. {Stairs:}The stairs are made from pine wood,tulip wood and pear wood.They were saved from the fire because they were thickly carpeted. {Venetian Room:}The name comes from the Venetian windows which overlook the parkland to the front of the house.The room was used as a ladies sewing room by Lady Enniskillen. {Bedroom:Lady Enniskillen's}bedroom was destroyed in the fire but the room was restored and the original wallpaper has been replaced.In the room is a large four poster bed and a dressing table on which is a travelling beauty case with a secret compartment.
